modules.description: The module offers typed decoding and validation for HTML form fields, enabling operations like type checks, range constraints, and conditional validations that depend on previously processed values. It works with data types such as booleans, integers, strings, dates, and form inputs, supporting structured handling of required/optional fields and list-based data. Use cases include enforcing complex business rules, such as validating a password strength based on a selected plan or ensuring date ranges align with user-provided criteria.

The module constructs and manipulates HTML attributes and tags, distinguishing between them via suffixes like underscores to resolve naming conflicts, while handling diverse data types including strings, enums, booleans, and specialized values such as `method_` or `shadowrootmode`. It enables precise control over element properties like `style`, `href`, and event handlers (`onblur`, `onclick`), supporting use cases such as form creation, styling, and DOM manipulation. Specific utilities include unescaped content handling for tags like `script` and `textarea`, as well as semantic tag construction for headings, tables, and embedded media.

Generates SVG attributes and elements using typed functions for styling and layout. Works with string attributes, enumerations for stroke properties, and structured tags for SVG elements. Constructs SVG content with precise control over shapes, colors, and coordinate systems.

The module offers functions for setting attributes on mathematical elements, converting types like booleans, integers, and strings into styling and layout properties such as spacing, sizing, and formatting. It works with XML-like structures and structured mathematical content, enabling control over elements like subscripts, superscripts, tables, and text. Use cases include rendering precise mathematical expressions with custom layouts and managing structural aspects like namespace declarations.

The module provides functions to define and manage ARIA attributes, operating on HTML elements with boolean, string, enumerated, numeric, and textual values to convey roles, states, and properties for accessibility. It supports use cases like configuring focusable interactions, dynamic content updates via live regions, and structured data presentation through properties such as row spans and value ranges. Patterned type conversions ensure semantic consistency, enabling precise control over assistive technologies' interpretation of web components.

Provides functions to create and manipulate XML namespace attributes and link elements. Works with XML attribute and tag data structures. Used to construct valid XML documents with proper namespace declarations and hyperlink references.

The module enables constructing and extracting structured RSS 2.0 feed elements, working with XML tags, attributes, and text-based content to manage metadata like titles, links, descriptions, and timestamps. It supports parsing and generating feeds by handling distinct tag types and extracting specific data such as language, last build dates, and TTL values for applications requiring feed interoperability or content aggregation.

The module offers functions to configure htmx attributes for dynamic web interactions, including HTTP method control, event handling, DOM manipulation, and real-time connections via WebSocket or Server-Sent Events. It operates on strings, HTML attributes, and boolean values, enabling client-side content updates and AJAX-driven workflows. Specific use cases include managing URL history, injecting raw HTML, and integrating Hyperscript for declarative event logic.

Injects a live reload script into HTML documents using type-safe dream-html nodes, and defines a route to handle reload requests. Works with Dream.route and HTML node structures to enable real-time updates during development. Used to automatically refresh a web application when source files change, without requiring manual page reloads.

Processes HTML elements by adding, removing, or modifying attributes and nested content. Operates on parsed HTML nodes represented as a tree structure. Used to dynamically update web page elements in real-time applications.

Provides functions to define and validate route paths at compile time, ensuring they start with a slash. Works with string literals to generate path values used in web routing. Enables safe, type-checked path creation and supports custom formatting for URL generation.

The module provides a comprehensive set of tools for building and manipulating HTML, SVG, and XML content with type-safe attributes, tags, and data handling. It includes form validation, ARIA support, mathematical and SVG styling, RSS feed management, and htmx integration, along with utilities for generating immutable static assets and live reload functionality. Data types include booleans, strings, integers, enums, and structured data, with operations ranging from attribute construction to complex validation rules. Examples include rendering styled SVG elements, validating form inputs with conditional logic, and generating accessible, dynamic web content with real-time updates.
